Installation¶

To get started, first create a virtualenv to install the project’s dependencies.

I suggest using virtualenv with the virtualenvwrapper. Here is a link that will guide you to configure this correctly. virtualenvwrapper

Then, clone the repo inside a folder where you keep your django projects.

With your virtualenv activated, run in the root of the project:

1
pip install -r requirements.txt

This will install the required dependencies.

Then, configure your settings, environments variables and database to your specifications.

Finally, run the following

1
2
3
4
python manage.py makemigrations
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py collectstatic
python manage.py runserver

The django project should be running at http://localhost:8000/
